body: I think it's an error caused by Windows device naming conventions (guid) in combination with Go's address parsing... I wonder what's correct here, will look into it.
I think we're missing []s somewhere too.
Enable STTRACE=log env var, and provide a proper log log with timestamps and lines around it when it happens again.
i set STTRACE with "set STTRACE=all" and after i restarted syncthing but nothing change is the log file. I use SyncTrayzor.
You have to launch synctrayzor from the same shell you set the env var, as `set` is local to the shell.

issue.title: Duplicate relays and addresses with the new discovery

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

body:
So I cannot reproduce the same issue.
I seem to get a different error: `percent-encoded characters in host`, but that's https://github.com/golang/go/issues/7991

Can you replace a few characters in the address with some other characters, rather than blanking them out with stars?

Pretty sure that^ is the problem. We get a local announcement over ipv6, just jam the port on after it with sprintf, and produce something nonsesical. Using net.JoinHostPort which is made to handle this correctly should solve it.

This issue still affects me:

```
Failed to parse connection url: tcp://[fe80::8e77:what:ever:9377%{09F88706-this-is-still-athing}]:39018 parse tcp://[fe80::8e77:what:ever:9377%{09F88706-this-is-still-athing}]:39018: hexadecimal escape in host
```

Between all my devices here in this local network, ST v0.12.0-rc6 64bit in Windows, ST v0.12.0-rc6 32bit in Linux and ST-Android v0.12.0-rc5

Indeed! We must escape the percent sign before the scope identifier, as per RFC 6874. Or rather, use `url.URL` to construct the URL string in the first place.

http://play.golang.org/p/P1eDY8tA0R

Thanks @chucic

issue.title: Failed to parse connection url: hexadecimal escape in host

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
Seen in the log during startup, shortly before syncthing connects to another device on the local network, using local discovery.

```
Failed to parse connection url: tcp://[fe80::21e:6ff:fea4:fdfd%{107D0076-9FB9-4334-BA63-C73D06E42D83}]:22000 parse tcp://[fe80::21e:6ff:fea4:fdfd%{107D0076-9FB9-4334-BA63-C73D06E42D83}]:22000: hexadecimal escape in host
```

Sometimes, however, I get this message instead

```
Established secure connection to 3MQH4HE at [fe80::ec42:b11e:b6a0:97de%{107D0076-9FB9-4334-BA63-C73D06E42D83}]:22000-[fe80::21e:6ff:fea4:fdfd%{107D0076-9FB9-4334-BA63-C73D06E42D83}]:53133 (direct-accept)
```
